outline.title: 4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES

chunks.text:
NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness
DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS
(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)

- Title | Data science Programming
- Course Number | CNTT1187E
- Number of credits | 3
+ Theoretical hours | 10
+ Discussion and group work period | 30
- Course Prerequisites: | CNTT1116

- Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan			Title:  PhD
Address: R1310, 13th floor., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong
Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Phone number:	0913537768		Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
- Full name: Tong Thi Minh Ngoc			Title:  MSc
Phone number:	0913002241		Email: ngoctm@neu.edu.vn

This course provides basic knowledge Data Analytical. Data Analytical Programming is a specialized course that provides content so that students can understand data and its basic characteristics. Students of analysis is the nature of data, classifying data, giving appropriate data analysis methods. Students can understand and use R data analysis software (or equivalent software) to set up a program to perform data analysis setup with applied information data analysis problems. , math problems. Advanced data analysis with software packages that unify and connect data from database management systems.
The course provides learners with knowledge about the process of data collection and processing, data preprocessing, data representation, some basic and advanced data analysis methods. The course teaches learners the skills to use R data analysis software to perform basic analyzes and other advanced analyzes such as clustering, decision trees, and financial data analysis. Through the learning process, students will practice more independent working skills, teamwork skills, problem presentation skills as well as a sense of professional ethics.

Course Book(s):
[1] Nguyen Van Tuan, Analyze data with R, Ho Chi Minh City Publishing, 2020.
Reference Book(s):
[2] Ngo Van Thu, Practical statistics textbook, National Economics University
[3] Data Mining - Concepts and Techniques - 3Rd - Han, Kamber and Pei - Morgan
[4] Software R and https://cran.r-project.org.
Software(s):  https://cran.r-project.org.

Table 5.1. Course Learning Outcomes
Goal | CLO | Description | Capacity level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | The course provides learners with knowledge about data collection and processing processes, data preprocessing, data representation, some basic and advanced data analysis methods. | PLO 1.5A | 3
G2 | The course teaches learners the skills to use R data analysis software to perform basic analyzes and other advanced analyzes such as clustering, decision trees, and financial data analysis. | PLO 2.2.2A | 4U, 4U, 4U
G3 | Develop the ability to work independently as well as in a team. Responsible in work and professional ethics. | PLO 3.1.1, PLO 3.1.2, PLO 3.2.3 | 3, 3, 3

Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes
Goal | CLOs | Description | Capacity level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | CLO1.1 | Understanding data and methods of preprocessing and representing data | 3
G1 | CLO1.2 | Understand basic and advanced data analysis methods | 3
G2 | CLO2.1 | Proficient use R programming for data analysis | 4U
G2 | CLO2.2 | Proficient in basic data analysis | 4U
G2 | CLO2.3 | Proficient in advanced data analysis: clustering, classification, decision trees, financial analysis | 4U
G3 | CLO3.1 | Ability to self-study and read materials to complete lessons and assignments | 3
G3 | CLO3.2 | Follow class rules. Have spirit of cooperation and personal responsibility for assigned activities. | 3

Table 7.1. Course assessment

[1] | [2] | [3] | [4] | [5] | [6]

Mid-term | Test 2 | Week 13 | CLO1.1 CLO1.2 CLO1.3 | Programming test | 40%
Final test | All chapters | Exam schedule | All CLOs | Final Exam | 50%

- Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
- Students are allowed to be absent for a maximum of 30% of the class hours. Students who are absent over 30% are not qualified to take the final exam.

chunks.text:
- The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders is prohibited.
- Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
- Cellphones, laptops, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for another entertainment purposes while in class duration.

NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness

(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)
1. GENERAL INFORMATION
- Title | Data science Programming
- Course Number | CNTT1187E
- Number of credits | 3
+ Theoretical hours | 10
+ Discussion and group work period | 30
- Course Prerequisites: | CNTT1116
2. LECTURER’S INFORMATION
- Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan			Title:  PhD
Address: R1310, 13th floor., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong
Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Phone number:	0913537768		Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
- Full name: Tong Thi Minh Ngoc			Title:  MSc
Phone number:	0913002241		Email: ngoctm@neu.edu.vn
3. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
This course provides basic knowledge Data Analytical. Data Analytical Programming is a specialized course that provides content so that students can understand data and its basic characteristics. Students of analysis is the nature of data, classifying data, giving appropriate data analysis methods. Students can understand and use R data analysis software (or equivalent software) to set up a program to perform data analysis setup with applied information data analysis problems. , math problems. Advanced data analysis with software packages that unify and connect data from database management systems.
The course provides learners with knowledge about the process of data collection and processing, data preprocessing, data representation, some basic and advanced data analysis methods. The course teaches learners the skills to use R data analysis software to perform basic analyzes and other advanced analyzes such as clustering, decision trees, and financial data analysis. Through the learning process, students will practice more independent working skills, teamwork skills, problem presentation skills as well as a sense of professional ethics.
4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES
Course Book(s):
[1] Nguyen Van Tuan, Analyze data with R, Ho Chi Minh City Publishing, 2020.
Reference Book(s):
[2] Ngo Van Thu, Practical statistics textbook, National Economics University
[3] Data Mining - Concepts and Techniques - 3Rd - Han, Kamber and Pei - Morgan
[4] Software R and https://cran.r-project.org.
Software(s):  https://cran.r-project.org.

[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]

G2 | The course teaches learners the skills to use R data analysis software to perform basic analyzes and other advanced analyzes such as clustering, decision trees, and financial data analysis. | PLO 2.2.2A | 4U, 4U, 4U
G3 | Develop the ability to work independently as well as in a team. Responsible in work and professional ethics. | PLO 3.1.1, PLO 3.1.2, PLO 3.2.3 | 3, 3, 3

9. COURSE REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTATION
9.1. Attendance Requirements
- Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
- Students are allowed to be absent for a maximum of 30% of the class hours. Students who are absent over 30% are not qualified to take the final exam.
9.2. In-class behavior Requirements
- The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders is prohibited.
- Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
- Cellphones, laptops, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for another entertainment purposes while in class duration.
INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | DEPARTMENT | LECTURER
